title: What the Omicron Variant Means for Travel Restrictions and Bans
sub_head: Here are travel policies from the U.S. and other governments, including the U.K., Japan and Israel
body:
The World Health Organization has declared the new Omicron variant of the coronavirus a “variant of concern,” indicating that it carries higher risks than other virus strains.
The U.S. is restricting travel from South Africa and seven other countries as a precautionary measure. The variant has been detected in the U.S. and in travelers to the U.K., Netherlands, Italy, Australia, Israel and Hong Kong, among others.
